website_summaries.verdict: When one calf is tight, the other one usually is, too. This double foot rocker from ProStretch lets you work on both sides at once.
pros: Automatically holds your feet in the best position for stretching
Can reduce pain in other parts of your lower leg
Fits up to men's adult shoe size 13
cons: Can be challenging to balance and stretch with both feet on the device and no way to brace yourself

customer_reviews.title: Super stretch for big growth
customer_reviews.text: Wow, best stretch ever. Historically I've used a slant board to stretch my calves but after using this the first time I had some difficulting walking the next day as my calves were so sore. I have extremely large calves that always elicit comments in the gym and I firmly believe that the reason they are so large is because of the amount of calf stretching that I did in my youth but these exceed anything I've ever used before. I think that if I had these when I was younger that my calves now would be bigger around than my thighs.
customer_reviews.author: Gregor

customer_reviews.title: Great stretch!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of the stretch but I have a problem most people don't so I can't use this everyday. The big toe on my right foot can't be bent up. There's a problem with the joint. I wish I had remembered that before buying this. Would've bought a flat stretching box instead. I can't complain about the stretch I get from it. Glad I bought the double one just for the convenience of stretching both at the same time. Absolutely best stretch I've ever gotten. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Centsless1

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for stretching the bottom of the foot and both the upper and lower calf muscles. The double ProStretch allows for a much greater stretch than the single ProStretch. The secret is to place one foot in one of the cradles to stretch that foot and leg, then enhance the stretch by placing the forefoot of your other foot on top of the heel cup of the empty cradle and adding weight to that side to increase the stretch. From reading other reviews of this product it seems that many people are unaware of this technique.
customer_reviews.author: osugrad85

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis so I need to stretch my calf a lot this dose it for me
customer_reviews.author: Eri s

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is so well made and fits any foot and holds any weight. I leave it out in the kitchen by the counter and everyone uses it all the time. You can stand on it with one foot and it does not tip over while you mount the other foot. It stretches the calves and helps my heel, which I shattered in 2009 and is held together with many pins and plates. I use it every day and so does everyone in the house and nearly every visitor. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi H. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Recommend it 100%
customer_reviews.text: I had bi-lateral full knee replacement this April. During therapy I used one. I loved it so much I had to have one for home. Now 3 months after surgery, still using it and still love it. Stretches out the muscles so nicely. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for recovering from plantar fasciitis, but it's a journey!
customer_reviews.text: Dealing with plantar fasciitis for 6 months. This helps stretch tight calf muscles to relieve plantar fasciitis. There's no one cure all for it. This helps. I've had cortisone shot in my foot twice. Also got shoe inserts from my podiatrist. It's a long process and plantar fasciitis does not go away overbite! I also tape my arch and it helps a lot! No one thing will give quick results!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Addington

customer_reviews.title: Life changer. End to physical therapy for good.
customer_reviews.text: Life changer. I have chronic issues with my feet, and I end up having to go for physical therapy every year for a few weeks. This has put an end to it. I go without weeks using it but as soon as I feel that the pain is going to flare up again, I get back on it for a couple of days, and I am good as new. Blessed the guy who designed it and went through the trouble of manufacturing and marketing it.
customer_reviews.author: Protima Chhabra

customer_reviews.title: Stretch it out
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool for stretching out your calves. My physical therapist has these at their location. Bought my own to continue with home exercises. Highly recommended. Extremely well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe Bruno

customer_reviews.title: The Pro Stretch Blue (double)  is very effective in reducing pain from plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: The ProStretch Blue (Double) definitely provides relief from plantar fasciitis for my husband, my adult son (cyclist) and adult daughter (runner) . I have bought this device for all three of these family members and all use it with great relief anytime their foot problems arise.
customer_reviews.author: petronella

customer_reviews.title: you can actually get a better stretch on your calves
customer_reviews.text: With the double, you can actually get a better stretch on your calves. It was an added bonus seeing that I loved the single!
customer_reviews.author: TD4HIM

customer_reviews.title: ProStretch
customer_reviews.text: My husband has suffered from leg cramps for a long time, our daughter showed this product to him and let him try it. He had no leg cramps that night, so we ordered our own. He has been using the prostretch for just a few days and he has had relief from the leg cramps, only 1 in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Soule

customer_reviews.title: a smart product
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of the 'single' food stretchers for many years and always regretted not getting the double. Recently I've had trouble with plantar fasciitis and decided to get the double to make treating the condition easier and more efficient, so that I would actually do it. This stretcher doesn't look like much, but it's actually very smart and effective. As soon as I started using it every day, along with a few other therapeutic techniques to stimulate blood flow, I felt a distinct lessening of pain. Very slowly and incrementally there has been a continued improvement in my condition. Hope I can get it to heal entirely eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Seefly

customer_reviews.title: It stretches my calves like nothing else and it does it quickly
customer_reviews.text: This works. It stretches my calves like nothing else and it does it quickly. My foot problem is not exactly the issue but friends with plantar fasciitis say it is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Choate

customer_reviews.title: Great for stretching the calve muscles!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for therapy for my ankle as I used the same in my physical therapists office .. it really stretches the calves out.. just don’t do too much right away as I could barely walk the next day lol
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: This stretches so good, both ways.
customer_reviews.text: I actually think I stand with better posture after stretching on this. I could feel greater flexibility after just the first day. I am stretching on this a few times a day, stretching both forwards and backwards, so that I am lengthening my calf muscle while getting my dancer toe in better shape as well. Really feels good. Great, simple stretch that almost anyone, no matter what condition, can benefit from.
customer_reviews.author: guitarQuest

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to overthink this. I have foot and Achilles tendon problems, and this device helps keep the pain away.
customer_reviews.author: vectorlogic

customer_reviews.title: Calf Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: I am able to stretch my calf easily and more effectively. I used this in my Physical Therapist's office and it was helpful with my calf stretches so I decided to buy one for use at home. I am glad I bought it. Very good.
customer_reviews.author: Vangee

customer_reviews.title: Too close together
customer_reviews.text: The rockers were too close together. Difficult for older people to keep their balance. I thought I had 60 days to return. 30 days isn't enough for after Christmas fare.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P. Jaycox

customer_reviews.title: For Quick Calf Exercising
customer_reviews.text: This works well if you do not want to work each calf muscle separately. You achieve a better stretch with the single unit. I use this and the single one, depending upon available time.
customer_reviews.author: A. M.

customer_reviews.title: good stretch
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapists had me using a ProStretch at their office ... and I realized I was stretching my lower leg muscles much more easily, quickly, and safely with it than with the "lean-against-the-wall" method. So, I found one on Amazon and bought it. It's a staple exercise device at the house. I leave it near the front door, which serves as a visual reminder to use it every morning.
customer_reviews.author: sieler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have this at home looks like the one at the physical therapists office.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowfax

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because I developed plantar fasciitis and my podiatrist gave me exercises to do, one of which was to stretch out the muscles. I have had this for several months, but was unable to use it until recently due to a trip and fall injury. Now that I am up and around the pain is back. I have been using this item for a couple of weeks now, and doing all the exercises. The pain is better, but not gone. I'm hoping it will still improve after using this longer.
customer_reviews.author: Msdblue

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This has helped my foot so much! I am back to walking the dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Carnow

customer_reviews.title: Good, but go easy
customer_reviews.text: This really helped with my plantar fasciitis. I had been doing the usual stretch exercises but they did not help the way this did. In fact, I felt better after doing this one time. However, subsequently, I apparently overdid it, and that led to another problem. So take it easy, and it should be very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky book lover

customer_reviews.title: Great for Plantar Facitis
customer_reviews.text: My husband has plantar facitis (sp?) and finds this exercise very helpful. He is an average to large man and the gear is plenty sturdy to stand on - although he holds onto the wall for added balance. He routinely uses it. We leave it out in a corner so he remembers. If I were to buy it again, I would probably just get the single one, but overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Great for Stretching
customer_reviews.text: I used this product during physical therapy and liked it so much I decided to buy one for home use. It allows for the deepest calf stretch I can achieve.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn K Mundt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool/toy
customer_reviews.text: Great tool to stretch/strengthen. I got slowly from full extension to full flexion to strengthen the weak spots on my calves
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like the pros use. Hight Quality.
customer_reviews.text: EXACTLY the same as the ankle therapist used in her office working on me. Can't beat being able to do some of the stretching at home and seeing faster improvement.
customer_reviews.author: denpick

customer_reviews.title: I liked it item but my feet was not sitting in ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked it item but my feet was not sitting in it correctly. The top of my feet with sneakers was over hanging and I did not feel like I was getting a good grip. I am a size 12.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I'm balancing after a few days!
customer_reviews.text: I have problems with my ankle from an accident. My chiropractor recommended this product. He told me to balance on it just a few minutes a day then get more creative with balancing techniques. When I first got it I had to hold on to the wall just to stay balanced. After about a week of balancing for only about 3 minutes a day, I can now balance without holding on and can rock back and forth. I will continue with balancing on one foot at a time, then get more creative. thanks
customer_reviews.author: rhamid

customer_reviews.title: ... have plantar fasciitis and this thing has done a wonderful job of stretching out my calf muscles
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and this thing has done a wonderful job of stretching out my calf muscles. It is surprising stable when stepping on and off. It has rubber strips on the bottom which grip hardwood or tile floors, so I feel pretty safe on it.
customer_reviews.author: SoccerCoach

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This ProStretch should be in every home...I have had 3 friends order in just the last week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useage
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for under your work desk. Same one used at PT appointments.
customer_reviews.author: MeMe

customer_reviews.title: ProStretch a hit!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product at Physical Therapy for a few months and felt that it was worth the cost to purchase one for my home. I use it every day- gives a GREAT calf and hamstring stretch. If you are strengthening after knee replacement surgery, this item is a MUST for you. Better to get the double than to keep switching back and forth with the single. Worth the $$ for the bi-lateral product. Fits all foot sizes- you line up your foot with the heel, so it works for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: colorfast

customer_reviews.title: Medi-Dyne ProStretch Bi-Lateral Stretching System
customer_reviews.text: This is the same stretching system I use in Physical Therapy. It's a great product which allows me to continue PT at home. I would highly recommend it. It comes with a book and you can order a video to increase your knowledge of how to use the product. I bet the video has tips they don't even know at PT.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: Works great for stretching calf, Achilles, plantar.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Bought a single initially but decided to get the dual to save time by stretching both legs at the same time. Took the single to work so I could stretch there also.
customer_reviews.author: Aqualung

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. If I hang on to something, like a countertop, and push back with my legs straight, it stretches everything from my heels up to my neck, but especially my lower back. I haven't found a better stretch for my lower back yet. It is a heck of a lot of money, though, so that's why only 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky Sparkarama

customer_reviews.title: Great stretch!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended if you get leg cramps or have plantar faciaitis (sp?). I take this with me (in my car) to use after we ride our bikes. Gives and amazing stretch to over-worked legs. This is the same one my PT uses.
customer_reviews.author: RecycleCarole

customer_reviews.title: Well built stretcher and worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband and he uses it on most nights to stretch out his legs as he is in his feet all day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Camacho

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and very sturdy product at a fair price. It really helps with my stretching routine.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really helps plantar fasciitis and heel spurs
customer_reviews.text: I have heel spurs that are secondary to plantar fasciitis after years of running and have been wearing high heels quite frequently for at least 15 years. I was told by my podiatrist that I need to stretch my achilles tendons and calves, but leaning against a wall or even standing on a step didn't give me a comfortable stretch, so I purchased the double ProStretch after it was recommended to me by a co-worker. I LOVE this item! It provides a much deeper stretch that has helped loosen up my feet and legs, relieving pain. It is also very sturdy, which makes me comfortable enough to trust it won't break while I'm using it. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: amazon1

customer_reviews.title: great quality and function
customer_reviews.text: The stretching apparatus works well and the quality of the materials is quite good. Can't complain. Stretching the calf muscles primarily: soleus and gastrocnemius.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Shagam

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it.....I have Plantar Fasciitis and my PT recommended getting this for use at home. Really does give me the stretch that I need so my feet feel better.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Blostein

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Product is great I used it at PT to help stretch my calves had to buy it for my house
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Great Stretching
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful for stretching out your calves, hamstrings or quads. Since both feet fit into them there isn't an issue with balancing or falling out. Plus you get to stretch both legs at the same time or twist to one side to concentrate on one side. This has been a miracle cure for me since I am always at the gym on either the treadmill or elliptical machines. It actually helped cure my plantar fasciitis. I also gave this as a wedding gift and the bride uses it daily now to help with her sciatica. One of those exercise equipment pieces that really works! Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: GoodKarma2

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I've used these things for years and give them to friends who are having trouble with tight hamstrings, Achilles tendonitis or who have trouble straightening knees after surgery. They work better than any exercise I've found.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: Great Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: I've developed plantar fasciitis and this tool is proving to of great benefit. I like that the manufacture has seen fit to put none slip, non marring rubber strips on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Dorena Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Great workout!
customer_reviews.text: These are great, really stretch your hamstrings and calf muscles out. Still don't know the difference between a double and a bilateral though.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: stretching system
customer_reviews.text: very good product. Just like the one the physical therapist has. I have been doing achilles stretches for years buy pushing on a wall. This is easier, and I am sure I am at the correct angle for the stretch.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but had to return
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but had to return, it was to small for my husband who's shoe size is larger then a size 13. Otherwise we would have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: krisjay

customer_reviews.title: Great Calf and Hamstring Stretch
customer_reviews.text: I have severely tight calf and hamstring muscles and 3 herniated disks in my lower back. I used the pro-stretch at Physical Therapy and wanted one at home. I use it daily and habe seen improvements. It is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good product. I saw it at my physical therapy office, and ordered one at Amazon. I use it almost every day! My back feels much better when I use it, and hurts a little bit if I forget to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C from NYC

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: The double ProStretch was what I had used for my office visit PT and I wanted the same for my at-home work. Solid design and can be used with one or two feet
customer_reviews.author: awesome game so addictive

customer_reviews.title: Wish I new about this earlier
customer_reviews.text: I have suffered from achilles tendinitis as long as i can remember. At the most, i would only be able to jog/run for a mile before my achilles would get so stiff and sore that i couldn't go on anymore. When i purchased the prostretch, i was skeptical that it would help because I had tried everything to combat it. Long story short, after using the prostretch for a week straight every night before i went to bed, my achilles tendom has not acted up at all during ny jogs. For the first time I was able to jog for more than 3 miles without any pain whatsoever. I can't believe i didn't know about this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little time on these each day and your plantar fasciitis and aching calf muscles will get better.
customer_reviews.text: This stretcher works. Spend a little time on these each day and your plantar fasciitis and aching calf muscles will get better.
customer_reviews.author: Lapu-Lapu

customer_reviews.title: I love it, My legs get a god stretch after ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it , My legs get a god stretch after I work out. I brought a single stretcher at a store. I saw this double stretcher for about the same price. So I ordered it and took the other one back. I am so glad I brought it. Gives a great stretch.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Good but controlled stretch
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by physical therapist for tightness in legs and feet. I use it several times per day and I like the ability to control the stretch as opposed to using steps.
customer_reviews.author: Mechil

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Never used it again after falling forward. Donated to goodwill. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: This has helped to stretch my Achilles tendon so I could get back to walking and off the couch. Cheaper than a visit to the doctor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for stretchhing
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a shoe! I find it is a very good way to stretch my calf muscles.
customer_reviews.author: AnnS

customer_reviews.title: Great physical therapy device!
customer_reviews.text: Has helped my back heal from a bad nerve injury. I would recommend this to anyone..even just to strengthen back and legs.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal DeKalb

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this at physical therapy while recovering from a broken ankle. I love having it at home. It is a fabulous way to stretch out both ankles/legs. Great for plantar fascitis, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Girl

customer_reviews.title: I love the stretch I get with Prostretch
customer_reviews.text: I love the stretch I get with Prostretch. Much easier on the foot than standing on the edge of a step.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Stretching
customer_reviews.text: After knee surgery, this helped in stretching my legs due to inactivity. I still use it and it feels great.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my physical therapist for my plantar fasciitis and this is great and it helped me. When using this make sure that you are wearing your sneakers since the back part do not have any soft support, so you will experience pain on the back of your feet if you are using this without any proper foot wear, but isn't it when you exercise you wear proper gym attire? This item can do the lateral stretch big time and I'm happy that it helped me. This is what I need, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Does what I need for much less than the wooden model that I used during Physical Training session a few months ago
customer_reviews.author: Ladeux

customer_reviews.title: Great stretch for foot and calf
customer_reviews.text: A great product for stretching the foot and the calf. I got hooked on the Pro Stretch in physical therapy and had to have one at home. Very good stretch especially in the calf. If you are looking for Plantar Fasciitis stretch, not necessarily the best, but provides some relief.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harper

customer_reviews.title: A must for PF
customer_reviews.text: Double rocker is the way to go. Good system for planitar faciitus.
customer_reviews.author: William Rossetter

customer_reviews.title: I just love it
customer_reviews.text: Put your feet in the warm water for few minutes . Dry your feet put your shoes and used a stretch pro. I just love it
customer_reviews.author: Norberto Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Bi-lateral stretching system
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in conjunction with the plantar fasciitis night splint and have seen remarkable improvement. I use it three to four times a day to keep the ligament stretched. It is easy to use and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Utahgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great way to stretch your calves
customer_reviews.text: The double prostretch allows me to stretch my calves much deeper than any other way that I have stretched them before. I also feel like I am able to strengthen my calves and feet. The online video that shows all of the exercises is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Caren Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Spend the extra money and buy the double unit. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: John S Shouse III

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd purchase (gave other 2 to family). Stretcher very effective. Highly recommended at currying or relieving a bad back
customer_reviews.author: AstoriaNY

customer_reviews.title: everyone needs a pro-stretch beside their bed ...!
customer_reviews.text: okay baby boomers with tightening calf muscles and shortening achilles tendons ... if you have trouble in the morning walking due to either of these scenarios get this tool! i have had two friends that were getting SHOTS to relieve the irritation of these muscle/tendon areas ... they found better relief with this item ... get one of these ...
customer_reviews.author: Weave

customer_reviews.title: Great stretching equipment for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these Pro-stretch bi-lateral devices at my physical therapy location. It was a great way to stretch before and after using other equipment. However, I was able to hold onto a rail when mounting/dismounting. So - just a word of caution - before purchasing this for home use, make sure you have a rail, bar... something sturdy to hold onto while using and mounting/dismounting. I do not have anything like this is my apartment and have had to place my hands on a wall while using, and I am VERY careful when mounting/dismounting. The actual device is very good and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Medi-Dyne ProStretch Bi-lateral Stretching System
customer_reviews.text: Using this bi-lateral stretching system allows the user to stretch both feet at the same time rather than having to stand awkwardly to stretch only one foot at a time on a unilateral system.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Medi-Dyne ProStretch
customer_reviews.text: Product worked as advertised. easy to use. minor balance issues, must hold on to something. I use stair railing or door jams.
customer_reviews.author: clwjr55

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love having this item at home. It has saved me time and lots of money. I can continue to do the exercises that I was shown in physical therapy. Keeps my plantar fasciitis and my knee issue in check. This is a solid piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Joan D.

customer_reviews.title: Super Sweet
customer_reviews.text: This item is all it claims to be and then a bit more. I did not expect a guide for differing exercises to come with it. I am delighted to have received that! Now I can do more than I learned in physical therapy. After working with weights for years, I can definitely say this tool is even better and safer for a great stretch. Thanks ProStretch and Medi-Dyne! I'll try more of your tools soon. PS
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: This was helpful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this at the recommendation of my physical therapist so I could stretch out my feet at home. It has helped to stop my plantar faciitis from returning.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Amaismeier

customer_reviews.title: All seniors should use this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Have been using one before for years by both of us daily, and it finally fractured (the plastic). So ordered another. Great for stretching Achilles tendons and for plantar facetious.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Krystofik

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Helps with stretching out back legs and Achilles heel.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These have given me great relief from plantars and achilles tendonitis. They arrived early and the product was as promised. You need to use them at least every day, and two to three times works even better. A small time commitment for a big benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Roeckl

customer_reviews.title: Good device, one small reservation
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the same device used in the physical therapy clinic I attend; it's well built, nonskid, and pleasant to use. My only negative comment would be that the information available for it -- both in the included pamphlet and on the Medi-Dyne website -- is mostly for the single-foot model, rather than this bilateral model. I don't understand why they failed to provide full info (including pictures) for both models.
customer_reviews.author: Question Lady

customer_reviews.title: This is great product!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this item to continue PT at home. Use it every day. So glad I purchased it. Serving the purpose I bought it for. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for stretching
customer_reviews.text: This is the same item that was used when I had physical therapy. Works great for stretching.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Ann Myers

customer_reviews.title: stretches my Hams
customer_reviews.text: Now, I don't have to go to the gym to do my stretching after my run. Sturdy equipment and portable
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Colbert

customer_reviews.title: and I loved it there
customer_reviews.text: I used this item in PT, and I loved it there, so I ordered it. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E. Baker

customer_reviews.title: medi-dyne pro-stretch
customer_reviews.text: seems to work as stated in ad. Rated it a four because it seems to be doing what it is supposed.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R Kappes

customer_reviews.title: Great calf stretcher
customer_reviews.text: I used this at PT, and when my husbands podiatrist said he needed to stretch his calfs to help his plantar fasciitis, I thought of the pro stretch PT200. It works great for this!
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This really helps stretch my Achilles. It does exactly what I need it to do. No need for more expensive physical therapy
customer_reviews.author: Holly Challis

customer_reviews.title: Relief for Tight Muscles
customer_reviews.text: After suffering from muscle spasms in my calves caused by over-exertion, I tried using ProStretch. After just a few minutes there was dramatic improvement. Now I use it for 10 minutes twice daily and haven't had any more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Meekie

customer_reviews.title: Great exerciser!
customer_reviews.text: This exerciser is great for stretching the Achilles tendon and relieving the strain on the plantar fascia, easing the pain of plantar fasciitis. Very well balanced--you can step on one side and it doesn't even wiggle.
customer_reviews.author: montana_gal

customer_reviews.title: Medical followup
customer_reviews.text: For Physical Therapy after a very bad ankle injury. It was recommended by the Physical Therapist and now that he is discharged from therapy, he continues the work at home. It has been a good tool in healing.
customer_reviews.author: chablis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My niece is 10, is a diver and has a heel injury. Her PT involves a series of calf and leg stretches, this system is use at PT and also part of her prescribed home routine. This small but significant equipment is helping her to live an active life as all children should. Consult your doctor before using it, it can be very heavy on the calf and leg muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Ann Rossiter

customer_reviews.title: Great Calf Stretcher
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product - it was worth the money. No more leg cramps !!
customer_reviews.author: Walter H. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I used this at my Physical Therapist's office. I like the bi-lateral because it stretches both legs at the same time, but you could still use it to stretch one leg at a time. Solid build/feel - you are paying for a professional product. It's use is a little novel, but effective.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Yes, It Does Help.
customer_reviews.text: I have Plantar Fascitis and have been using this on the days that I do not go to therapy. It definelty helped to speed up my healing process. My therapist suggested I continue to use this after I complete my therapy sessions. Make sure you have something to hold onto when you use it. I highly recommend it. It does work.
customer_reviews.author: DER

customer_reviews.title: Best to lose weight and stay away from inflammatory foods
customer_reviews.text: Used this product in physical therapy for sciatica calf pain. Best to lose weight and stay away from inflammatory foods. Listen to your body!
customer_reviews.author: usais1

product_meta.title: ProStretch "Blue" (Double) - The Original Calf Stretcher & Foot Rocker for Plantar Fasciitis, Achilles Tendonitis & Tight Calf Pain (Slip Resistant Bottom)
product_meta.description: For over 20 years, ProStretch has been the favorite calf stretcher of professional athletes, athletic trainers, and Physical Therapists worldwide. Professionals have recognized that using the ProStretch Original calf and foot stretcher before and after exercise effectively helps reduce the risk of injury. There are various benefits of using ProStretch over conventional methods. ProStretch’s unique biomechanically engineered foot rocker design allows for stretching your calf and other lower leg muscles evenly using in a gentle rocking motion. It automatically holds the foot in the optimal angular position to ensure an accurate and efficient stretch that is proven to relieve your lower leg muscles and foot pain, such as tight calves, ankle strengthening, and other chronic conditions. ProStretch also comes with a slip-resistant rubber strip bottom surface which ensures the device stays in place while in use. Used for preventing and treating: Plantar Fasciitis, Achilles Tendonitis, Shin Splints, Tight Calf Muscles, Tight Hamstrings, and Heel Pain Who Needs ProStretch? Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation: ProStretch reduces the domino effect of chain reaction injuries. Athletes: ProStretch helps stretch the calf, hamstring, and foot muscles. Using ProStertch on a routine basis reduces and prevents injuries. Anyone suffering from Plantar Fasciitis, Achilles Tendonitis, Tight Calves, and other chronic lower leg chronic conditions. Stretching helps gently elongate the tendons on the bottom of your foot and leg used over a period of time can reduce pain and further injury. ProStretch is easy to use, durable and portable, which makes it convenient to take with you to the gym, home, office, and sports game. It fits adult shoes up to size 12 and has a recommended weight limit of 250 lbs. Package Includes: Blue ProStretch Original Calf and Foot Stretcher and user Guide with exercises information
feature_bullets: TRUSTED - Medically proven and found in physical therapy clinics worldwide. ProStretch provide a deeper and more effective stretch than conventional methods such as floor or curb stretching
PREVENTS & TREATS COMMON LOWER LEG AILMENTS - Using ProStretch daily reduces pain caused by Heel Pain, Plantar Fasciitis, Achilles Tendonitis, Shin Splints, Tight Calves and Hamstrings
SLIP RESISTANT BOTTOM - Advanced rubber strips on bottom of ProStretch protect against moving and sliding, allowing for a safe and effective stretch
DURABLE AND PORTABLE – Built strong and lightweight, making it easy to take it to the game, the office or the gym
MADE IN U.S.A. - Fits adult shoes up to size 12. Recommended weight limit 250 lbs
